website_summaries.verdict: A capable gimbal that holds cameras as well as smartphones
pros: Works well and is compatible with cameras, smartphones, and GoPro cameras
The counterweights are easy to adjust
Supports phones and cameras up to 2.1 lbs
cons: Mastering this gimbal takes some practice, and some customers found the need to add washers to the counterweights for a wider weight range

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED USED. MULTIPLE ISSUES. SAD.
customer_reviews.text: Product itself is GREAT. However, it seems that I received a PREVIOUSLY OWNED roxant pro. I tried to give the benefit of the doubt in testing it with my camera on, ignoring the obvious scuffs & wear and tear from a previous owner, but then when I removed my Canon G7X, the grip on the Roxant which makes physical contact with the camera came right off. Clearly it was not manufactured (glued) correctly & clearly I received a defective/used. Now I have to postpone what I needed to shoot because of this easily avoidable mistake.
customer_reviews.author: St. Davis

customer_reviews.title: High VfM, Professional Quality steady cam for DSLR, ILC and Smartphone
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the color and metal looks excellent and so far it does seem to be very solid. My original intent was to get this for my wife for when she documents marches, so that she can have steady footage with her google pixel, but then when I saw how nicely built it was, I thought I could use it with my camera. The size and weight seem perfectly suitable for our purposes, it should be good for extended periods and is also unobtrusive in a documentary environment and so shouldn't scare subjects. For use with DSLRs, ILCs, and smartphones, this is a really fine product, and actually surprised me with the value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Tainer

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: 1000% quality build. I love the look! Super sleek, with a high quality finish. Feels really nice to use. I do wish there was 1 or 2 more millimeters of movement in the ball piece, but that is a small issue. I shoot, edit, and manage Facebook ads for local real estate agents. This helps me get really high quality movement shots which adds to the appeal of any space. People love to be able to move around, of course, and smooth camera movements help the customer feel what it would be like when if they moved there. Highly reccomended for smaller cameras! (under 2.5 lbs is perfect)
customer_reviews.author: Charlie C. Michael IV

customer_reviews.title: Roxant Gimbal Review
customer_reviews.text: This product is much lighter and better suited for me than the large Zhiyun gimbal I've been using. It feels very smooth and the weight is not a problem at all. The design is simple and modern but without all the complicated electronic components that come with battery powered gimbals. The quality seems very good and especially for the price, I'm enjoying it. I bought this for myself and I plan on using it for novice film making and action shots around the world wherever I travel and any documentaries I make.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, excellent documentation
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is great. A lot of times machined aluminum items can have burrs or imperfections, but it's obvious the Roxant QA process is very good. It's amazing Roxant was able to create such a useful and quality device so inexpensively. The online tutorial videos are a great help, and easy to follow. I was able to get my DSLR and iPhone balanced very quickly after watching the video. I bought the device to use in helping a friend with an independent movie project, and am looking forward to the results we'll get using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble balancing it at first and, in hindsight, probably damaged the bearing in the process. Nonetheless, Roxant sent me a new bearing assembly as well as the upgraded handle. I love the new handle and, after watching the recommended tutorials, succeeded. The upgraded handle is great. I have made a couple of walk-through videos for real estate listings and they are head-and-shoulders above any handheld videos I have made. Thank you Roxant for your patience, understanding and outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Stabilize video and keep a stable wallet.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the Roxant Pro while looking for camcorder accessories on Amazon. I liked its appearance and its seemed of high quality for the price. This is my first ever stabilizer/gimbal purchase. I plan to try it with a Sony Handycam, Canon DSLR and Nikon digital camera (all three shoot video). My first impression is that it seems durable. I like the design and color..its gives off a sporty yet serious appearance. To me it feels heavy so I know it will take me some practice and getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: 1duhrfool

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know how it works as well as it does...
customer_reviews.text: The unit it extremely well made and looks good. It feels good in the hand and the design seems super smart. Color looks good, size and weight (options) are fine, but I’ve never had anything like this so I don’t know what to compare it to. I bought it for myself because my 5 year old daughter wants to start her own YouTube channel. I just wanted something that would get the job done and didn’t break the bank. As a quick test, I ran down the hall and couldn’t believe how stable and fluid the footage was. Honestly, it didn’t make sense to me. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service, mediocre product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be a relatively cheaper way to steady my camera for a project I'm involved in, but after reviewing my shaky footage, I decided to return it and purchase an electronic gimbal. The difference is staggering. Even though I was moving very slowly and carefully with the Roxant Pro, and took my time setting it up properly, the shots looked shaky. With the electronic gimbal, however, I can move quickly in any direction, point the camera in any direction, run with the gimbal, and 90% of the time my shot is ridiculously smooth. I wish I could recommend the Roxant Pro because the company's customer service is the best ever, but I cannot.
customer_reviews.author: Booyakashalaka

customer_reviews.title: Buy It! Best Bang for your Buck, and AWESOME Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: It looks awesome! And it works! Takes a little getting used to, but if you spend about 30 minutes watching some tutorials on the proper way to set your rig up you'll be ready to go! It's pretty intuitive once you understand it. I'm going to be using it to shoot for personal and business use with Pixel 2 XL and a GoPro - I've already shot multiple takes with the Pixel and it's sweet! And to top it all off, the customer service is unreal - personal emails and all, just to make sure I got started on the right foot, it's awesome! One of the best purchase experiences I have had on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jack R. Raine

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying the stabilizer so far. It is a bit of a pain to get everything balanced, but I think that's a given with these kinds of products. I purchased it for the purpose of shooting video for my business, and my first impression was that it was very solidly built. I saw that transitions were smooth and you couldn't detect footsteps as I walked around the room doing a test run of its stability. It does what it's supposed to do, and I'm looking forward to using this for all my projects to come. All in all, I am a happy customer and I would recommend the product
customer_reviews.author: Sue C Orr

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: So far, the gimbal works great. I’m still getting used to it, but it has a nice weight and feel to it. I’m not a fan of these ball joints with the plastic wing to tighten. But I received another unrelated piece from a different company today with the same mechanism, so I guess it is standard? It seems a bit cheesy/flimsy to me, when the rest of the construction is metal. I will say one thing though: It is the best thing I’ve seen out there for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A1TechnoGodess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing with the stabilizer this morning and learning to set it up through their videos. I think I finally got it all set up. Quality of the product is a 5 star, nice heavy metal parts and no plastic makes is a quality product. I like the weights in three different sizes as it makes it easier to set up. All parts are finished properly and rounded for comfort. Speaking of comfort, the grip is wonderfully balanced and the robber gives you control and comfort at the same time. Definitely recommend it by itself yet the customer support makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Abuelo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit so far. It's my first stabilizer so it took me a little while to get balanced. I'm first trying it with a Canon point and shoot but will be using it for a full DSLR and also a GoPro. I love the color and the build quality seems great. Don't forget to grease the gimbal! I bought it for an upcoming trip to Africa in May. We'll be doing a lot of walking treks so I thought this would be perfect. I will update this review after that trip since the Roxant will be used heavily then.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!  Best Bang for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing video since there was video and I can tell you it's a wonderful thing to find such a reasonably priced functional unit as this! Note: Be Sure to watch the Otis Originals Video's  They will make set up quick and easy! Great Purchase! Best Bang for the Buck!
customer_reviews.author: James M Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the camera very stable.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and easy to put together, a little heavy if your not used to it but I got used to it within a few days. Keeps my Lumix camera very stable while doing walk around head shot videos for my you tube channel and is easy to adjust to get the camera level no matter what camera you are using. I would recommend this to any one wanting to make better more stable videos. Also the instructions videos are very clear and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Westlund

customer_reviews.title: I put the oil as recommended, but still having trouble using it
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to use for my sony handycam, and I then tried using, but maybe I need more time to work on it! I put the oil as recommended, but still having trouble using it, plus its a little heavy than I thought, but will practice more. So I'm not sure if the black one is lighter than this which probably I should buy instead. But overall, still nice to have tools, once I have a spare time, will practice and enjoy the benefit of the stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Toys and More

customer_reviews.title: These guys have great products
customer_reviews.text: Regarding this stabilizer... first, it’s very well made, the handle is easy to grab and hold on to. Second the rest of the construction is very sturdy. I also like the fact that there are several ways to adjust the stabilizer, according to the videos. And speaking of the videos, they seem very concise. This is not the first product I have purchased from Roxant. A while back I bought one of their monoculars to use on my trips into the boonies. BEST ONE EVER! These guys have great products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: You need patience and skill to get a steady video with this stabilizer.
customer_reviews.text: Are my videos less shaky? Yes. Do all the videos now make me look drunk? Yes. Don't expect to put your camera on here and have perfectly stable videos. I learned the hard way, it takes a good amount of time to balance your camera with the counter weights. After that, there is a significant learning curve. Instead of investing the time to set it up and build the muscle memory this requires; consider getting a part time job and saving the money to buy a real gimbal.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Nehlich

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: When I took it out of the box I have to say I like the looks and feel of it. It's very sturdy and the color red makes it look like I spent a fortune on it. The size and weight are just right. I'll be using my GoPro with the stabilizer so I'll probably have to get some lighter washers to accommodate the camera. I've been looking for something I could use when I go on vacation to steady my camera and I think I found what I need.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cox

customer_reviews.title: It took my a good 30mins to find the perfect balance for my Canon ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time balancing it at first. It took my a good 30mins to find the perfect balance for my Canon EOS 77D with 50mm 1.4 lens. Once I got the hang of it, I was able to balance my camera with my other lenses as well as my Go Pro 5. I highly suggest that once you find the perfect balance, mark it on your stabilizer so you can go back to it easily next time you change lens or camera. I'm giving it a 4 just because of the difficulty I had in the beginning. Otherwise, this is a good and cheap stabilizer if you can't afford to buy the gimbal.
customer_reviews.author: Jerish Fabro

customer_reviews.title: Simple, straight forward and it works
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stabilizer. It is well made with excellent materials. Balancing was pretty simple after watching the tutorial videos. You really have to watch the videos. It will make your life much easier. I'm using this with a Sony RX100 Mk3. The stabilization is pretty good, especially considering the cost. Straight forward and no frills. Just right for videos on my blog.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Design and Construction that Performs!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my Red Edition stabilizer this week and I'm finalizing the balance on it-extremely pleased with the results thus far. The quality and build are impressive and I'm excited to take it on the road with me. I've just started dabbling in 4k videos when I travel and this is proving to be a valuable asset to my ensemble. I don't want to travel with "large" equipment and this fits my model perfectly. And I need something that will be easy to handle as I hike remote trails and record whatever adventures befall us. Thank you, Roxant!
customer_reviews.author: KerryS

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, I like the build, I like the weight. I like that it is compact. I use it with the Canon M50 to take video and it works well. I sometimes do video work at corporate events and the small size allows me to move through crowds fairly easily. The only thing that would make it even better, is if there was a way to make it more compact so that I could fit it better into a camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great design and awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great design and awesome product! The tutorial video on how to set it up as a must see. To begin with it looks like it might be difficult. But, the tutorial video makes it very simple. And the customer service? They honestly seem like the most friendly and helpful people I’ve worked with. I’m pretty sure any issue I have will be resolved as quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and performing stabilizer.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for making a quality product. We will be using this to make videos of campers and staff this summer at Covenant Mountain Mission Bible Camp. The set up did take a while but the result is amazing. After shooting hand held last year this will drastically improve our video quality. The stabilizer works wonderfully and will make our productions look much more professional. Updates will follow as we use this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very simple principle, works great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid device , and based on simple physics, It’s basically a teeter totter. If you don’t watch the videos first you will get frustrated setting it up. After watching them, I was able to do it in 10 minutes with my Go pro. I don’t know why there’s reviews saying they had to “hack” it , because it was fine out of the box for me. I look forward to using it to get smoother more professional footage.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sinister

customer_reviews.title: The Product is Amazing, takes some time to adjust, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: The device is solid and very sturdy, the design is elegant and easy to adjust, The setup was simple and fast, and the videos to help me set it up and use it are extremely helpful. I make YouTube videos with My GoPro and My sony A6000 camera. Now that I have better software and I have more opportunities with my free time I would like to Make better quality videos, and one of the huge problems that I recognize in all of my videos is that they are all shaky videos. The color red is very vibrant and overall device seems to be made of high quality
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item around February 6 2020. So far I’m happy with it Crafted very well. The parts looks great. The construct is very well designed The parts feel very strong and sturdy I’m still learning how to balance my Nikon camera on it. It’s a learning process. Overall I think it’s a really nice product, I just need to fine turn the adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth joseph

customer_reviews.title: Works well for cool smooth floating/flighty shot angles
customer_reviews.text: I must say I am very happy with it. While it doesn't replace a $400+ gimble. It's still extremely effective and feels good to me. Set up takes patience but it's not bad. I do wish it had a quick disconnect so replacing batteries or SD cards didn't require removal and reset of the entire unit. But the build quality feels good and it definitely stabilizes the shot. I also like to lock the handle for certain situations to use as a pistol grip handle for shooting. I use a Cannon EOS M50 and I'm happy I bought this low budget but very effective stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to set up, didn't stabilize things that much
customer_reviews.text: I watched the videos they recommend (32 minutes long, with the title "how to set up any camera in 5 minutes!") as well as some other ones, and it was not intuitive. I eventually got a reasonable balance, but it was a fair hassle. The setup guide recommends using 3-in-1 oil, which costs about $3. I wish they would just include it. Most of my videos ended up with a slight sway, and I'm not sure I'll use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris_C

customer_reviews.title: Well built, couldn't get it balanced
customer_reviews.text: Could never get the weight correct, I even bought extra washers to balance out the camera. I'll assume it's the user and not the product that couldn't get it to work. Having said that, I spent many hours trying to get it perfect with no success so...it's 3 stars because it does take a while to get the camera balanaced correctly if the camera is, itself designed without an easily discoverable balance point. Perhaps it was the camera's shape which made it more difficult and perhaps there wasn't enough variation in the positions you are able to set the camera to.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Chernochan

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement to my videos
customer_reviews.text: My first thoughts when I opened the package were that this is going to last a long time. It feels very well made. I got the red Edition which really stands out, but not in an obnoxious way. I think the weight is perfect for for the Canon XA10 that I will primarily be using it with. I will mostly be using it at events. I haven't had the chance to use it for a long time yet, but the short videos I made with is so far are a huge stability improvement over just handheld. I am really glad I made this purchase and excited to use it at my next event.
customer_reviews.author: Libardo P.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My thoughts about the product. I used it last weekend to shoot a wedding. I am using a 1.7 lb HD video camera. The unit is well-made. It was more sensitive than i had imagined, a near microscopic change in the balance arm or camera position changes everything. The device did do a very good job of removing shake. I wish there was a way to remote adjust the zoom of the camera as any touch to the camera zoom button throws everything off. In short, for about $60 it is a good alternative to a much much more expensive steady cam.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: I like the sleek look
customer_reviews.text: I like the sleek look. It feels lightweight and easy to use. It feels like it is made for compact and hard to get into spaces. The red color gives it a "look at me" feel to it. The size and weight are exactly what I am looking for. I do not want something big and clunky. It appears well built and a lot of thought went into the compact design. I plan to use it as part of my real estate tool kit when the agent wants video clips stitched together.
customer_reviews.author: Hoverpilot

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable product. Smooth, well finished, light, yet heavy enough to be sturdy and that it is. Easily customized to my liking and needs by adding extra and different size washers as weights. Added a cell phone holder from a selfie stick. Really smooth video yet retains the action I want. Highly suggest you have one of these. Love the battery free and electronic free design. Tons of you tube videos on using and customizing these. Amazon customer ratings came through for me on this one!
customer_reviews.author: TinkermanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It works. But will it work well enough for you?
customer_reviews.text: After working with this stabilizer for several hours I just wasn't completely satisfied with the results. It's not that it didn't work at all it's that it didn't work well enough for the kind of shots I need to compile. I've concluded that the Roxant Pro (and other similar stabilizers) are useful for a particular kind of shot and not many others. Specifically they're useful for shots in which a little bit of camera sway may actually add to the video rather than detract from it. So, walking shots, action shots, etc., are likely fine (with a fair bit of practice) for this stabilizer. However, if you need rock solid and smooth, gliding footage I just can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great part of any kit.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like my new Roxant Pro. It seems built very well and seems like it will last a long time. Another thing is it is not electronic and in need of batteries. I can go for as long as I want and never have to worry about a battery running out on a shoot. I am a photographer and plan to use it on shots for my tutorial videos. I think it will add a little more class to the videos.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Move the weight uphill
customer_reviews.text: This stabilizer is great! I have an older Canon EOS (600d) camera and virtually none of the motorized stabilizers work with it. The Roxant stabilizer is universal and a great solution for my older camera body. It took a little time to get the balance right, but the videos are a big help. The best tip of all is to move the weight uphill. Once I got my head around the concept the balancing process was pretty easy. The product is well made and seems very durable. I do a lot of outdoor environmental training videos and I was looking for something easy to use outdoors. This is a great product and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Seelinger

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: The look and design are great. Feels really good. Overall, good size and weight. Color isn’t important to me. It appears to be of good quality. I’m using it for DSLR video footage. I shoot a wide range of video. This tool will help me expand my scope of jobs. Good video instruction.
customer_reviews.author: MilRod

customer_reviews.title: Decent price if you can figure out the physics
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we found this product too complicated to use. Purchased as an affordable alternative to very expensive DSLR gimbals/stabilizers but just trying to balance out the weights and follow the steps just made it not worth it for us and we decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great stabalizer
customer_reviews.text: This stabilizer is great. It's very durable and works really well once you get it balanced. Make sure to watch the videos created by the company. They really help out with getting it balanced. I recommend getting some large washers like the guy suggests in the video. I was trying to balance a GoPro and had to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea, but no.
customer_reviews.text: I kept seeing a bunch of videos for this, my buddy even has one and reccomended i get it. well i did, and i absolutely hate it lol. i have a canon t5i which is a medium weight camera, unfortunately this roxant can not hold it because the camera is heavier than the roxant. this is really something good for small lightweight cameras. don't even think about adding attachments to it or you'll never be able to balance it. i reccomend just saving your money and getting something better.
customer_reviews.author: Do It All Entertainment

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, Easy to Travel With, Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I was drawn to the stabilizer because it got many great reviews on Amazon and from the customer videos I'd seen it seemed easy to use. I bought this for myself because I am a GoPro accessory fanatic. I also travel quite a bit, so stable video on the go is a plus. I received it and here are my thoughts... - I like the sleek red design. - The size works because I can fit it into a backpack or small case. The fact that I can disconnect the handle makes it easy. - I like the adjustable weight. - Quality seems solid, I trust that it won't break or fall apart on me. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine M Convento

customer_reviews.title: Roxant Pro works great with my Sony RX100 IV
customer_reviews.text: I got the Roxant last week and I tried it briefly and it felt well made.I want to use it with my new Sony RX100 IV. I will watch the videos on line and I know that with some practice I will get good results with both the Sony RX100 IV and also a Go Pro Hero 3. I love the colour! Why does most prosumer video stuff has to be black?! I sure appreciate some colour while I work! And They will also send me a low profile handle for free! Can't beat this deal...first rate after sale customer service which is something I don't see very oftern nowadays. Good product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions: Roxant Pro Stabilizer, Red Edition
customer_reviews.text: My first impression of the Roxant Pro Stabilizer is that it is well-thought out in design, solidly built, and the most affordable stabilizer on the market for my current purposes. I like the build, like the looks, and really like the portability. I'm really looking forward to using the Roxant Pro Stabilizer with a variety of my gear, large and small, and putting it to work regularly as I wander North America. As I use it more and more, I'll update this review with any further observations I may have.
customer_reviews.author: Road Manring

customer_reviews.title: Easy to balance
customer_reviews.text: I found balancing the gimbal was fairly easy. Just follow the steps shown in the video. We are fulltime Rv'ers so we travel a lot. We document our travels and doing a video while walking and trying not to shake the camera was frustrating. The test videos I have done up to now look much better. I'm pleased with my purchase. The instructional videos are pretty good. Remember, not to lock the the locking mechanism on the grip. Do it only when installing the grip to the gimbal. I was kind of confused with that. Only after watching other videos I confirm that it should be unlocked.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't have hoped for anything better!
customer_reviews.text: I have essential tremor and I take videos that I convert to actual movies with a special program so I needed something that could actually keep the shaking down to a minimum! This product is amazing. I did a trial run and found that the shaking was almost non-existent. The company also is very hands-on. I received a couple of emails offering any assistance I might need for setup and mentioned that they are there whenever needed. Wow a great company with a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Merry a Vero Beach, FL Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective. Tried it out today with someone for a test shoot while running next to them and it was amazing. Loved it. Can't wait to master it. Can't wait to try other cameras with it. Used it with G7X mark ii today. Will try phone and 5D mark ii as well. Will use it on the boat and walking and riding etc to get stable hand held shots. Felt slightly frustrated with trying to set it up and balance it, but that comes with the territory. Hang in there and watch the Otis videos about how to balance it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Blonde

customer_reviews.title: The unit looks good and feels like it is made of quality components
customer_reviews.text: The unit looks good and feels like it is made of quality components. I bought it for myself and I hope to use it while traveling. I'm still not sure if I'm balancing it correctly as it tends to drift or tilt in one direction or another. Even though my skills with the device are still at beginner level, my footage is dramatically more stable than using the camera by itself. I think this device is a great option for people on a budget or for beginners, maybe even professionals who want something smaller to stabilize their footage. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a great cost point
customer_reviews.text: I am new to stabilizers and wanted something to get my feet wet with. After reading reviews i decided on the Roxant Pro. This is a great unit! Watched the videos and got the rig balanced and dialed in in pretty quick time. The look is great, Nice color combo, handle is comfortable, construction and materials are really nice. Sturdy, nice finishes and well made. It's already made a difference in the quality of my videos. I would highly recommend this unit and look forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product, wonderful company
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a Christmas gift for my 21-year-old son. He takes a lot of videos for his youtube channel and uses his bike in a lot of them, so this will really be useful to him. More importantly, the company is amazing to deal with. They care very much about your satisfaction with the product. I've never dealt with a company quite like it before and they've just been terrific to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Terri L Garrett

customer_reviews.title: High quality piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This camera stabilizer was surprisingly easy to use (others may disagree as this type of equipment takes some getting used to)... It is very sturdy, made of very good materials, does not seem likely that it will break at all. If you use a gopro, all you need to do is purchase a very inexpensive adaptor from amazon. This tool is pretty nifty because you can follow another person in action and the footage stays smooth. Highly recommend this product if you are going to do some video work! It has proven to be high quality.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, rugged.
customer_reviews.text: I am a filmmaker, but usually leave my camera work to my crew & DP. However, I wanted to start using my iPhone to make smaller projects so that’s what brought me to the Roxant. I looked at several stabilizers, but this one seemed the most rugged and well built. I was not disappointed. Initially, it was difficult to balance it out with my iPhone, but between my own stubbornness and the videos they provided I was able to get it balanced. We took it out and shot a test film and we were very happy with the results. I whole heartedly endorse it and look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost alternative to more expensive gimballs
customer_reviews.text: So far it looks very well built and I am very satisfied with the service. I took it on a trip to Niagara Falls for the holiday weekend and it definitely has a learning curve. I did get a couple of nice videos with little bobbing, but I think I have not yet set it up 100%. I bought the unit in preparation for an upcoming trip to Iceland (last week of July). I have started setting it up with my GoPro and I am still some ways from getting it to be real stable.
customer_reviews.author: Camilo

customer_reviews.title: Great Stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: We just used the stabilizer at a wedding. Very pleased with build, color, and performance. (Used with Sony A7 with external mic and with an LED mic in another configuration) I watched the video on YouTube to help get set up. The video was very useful. Takes some patience It looks like a very professional piece of equipment. I bought it for business. And I'm giving it to my daughter who is starting her own video business A couple more slots to position the camera would make this a more awesome device
customer_reviews.author: Jay Billups Creative Media

customer_reviews.title: It looks great and works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wow, It looks great and works awesome. Thank you folks for the elegant design and build quality . Worth every penny. Design is very simple, mechanical, elementary but phenomenal. I could genuinely appreciate the fundamentals behind your design. I am new to this and was using a Feiyu G5 V2 gimbal for my GoPro. Tried ROXANT PRO with my new 4k Sony FDR AX53 and it was funny that I was able to get a nice balance in a couple of attempts. Of course I watched handful of OTIS YouTube videos beforehand. Here is a clip from my very first attempt. Practice, practice and practice again; that is the key.
customer_reviews.author: Vasans

customer_reviews.title: Solid product that works for a low cost.
customer_reviews.text: I feel the design is very solid and able to withstand a lot of abuse. It does weigh a little more than I thought it would but that might be because I might not have it set up just right yet since I just received the product this week. I bought this for myself to take family videos and to also start a YouTube channel of reviews. As I use this more I will update!
customer_reviews.author: Nemesis

customer_reviews.title: Set up os trial and error but that’s just the nature of a stabilizer!
customer_reviews.text: Received my stabilizer a couple days ago and watched the video on setting it up. It took me awhile but I think I have it locked in for my GoPro. I’ve done a bunch of videos with that camera hand held and wasn’t satisfied with the bounce of my walking. That was the reason for my purchase. I mainly use it for car show videos and am looking forward to trying the stabilizer at the next show in Los Angeles. The handle that came with it is very comfortable. The unit does weigh more than I expected but not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, Great price!
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and has a great feel to it just out the box! The feel is exactly what I expected when ordering! The design is Awesome! With really light camera such as the GoPro session it would only balance with view of the rig in the gram when recording. So simple yet effective! The colors are cool! Weight is good! And size is ideal! I got it so that I can use one stabilizer for all of my devices. I’m using it to capture the new moments I’m having with my new baby girl! Also just capturing the most beautiful video I’ve ever shot my self I love this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We found the product sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We found the product sturdy and easy to use. The videos that you recommended were helpful, as it can initially be a bit confusing regarding how to get the proper balance. The reminders regarding oiling it were also very helpful, as that was definitely something that made a huge difference. We are definitely not experts with it yet, but we feel like the product has already resulted in us shooting better videos. For the money, this is a very good buy – especially for someone who wants to improve the steadiness of their videos more so than the average person but who doesn’t want to pay more than $100 for bulkier “professional” equipment.
customer_reviews.author: L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Took me over a day's worth of trial and error ...
customer_reviews.text: Took me over a day's worth of trial and error to get the right balance. I almost wanted to give up and return it. However, I was finally able to figure out how to get a 2 second drop. Since every camera is different, there was not one youtube video that I found very helpful on how to get the right balance. For this product, its a lot of trial and error, and just figuring out the right balance. But once you find the right balance, this thing is solid!
customer_reviews.author: Romy E.

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe the shots I get with this thing
customer_reviews.text: I used this for quite a few shots and my final review is that it's amazing. The shots I can get with this thing are unreal and it's so lightweight I can take it with all my gear. I use it with a Panasonic GH4 and hasn't been too difficult to calibrate. Once you get it down, about 20-30 minutes for me at first, it works like a charm. The shots honestly look like they came out of a professional rig, which I've used in the past. If you're doing any kind of hand held shooting this is the best investment you can make. Drastically changes how everything looks.
customer_reviews.author: David Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: returned BUT amazing over all!
customer_reviews.text: i decided to return since i recently got a higher budget, the company cares and listens to the costumer when you email them, it's astounding! they even personally emailed me and ask for details on what i thought about it! great people over there honestly. the quality is amazing, and the stabilizer is great budget wise and for fast movements, since my budget is higher i plan on getting a gim ball, a glide cam is too hard for me to master😂 thank you costumer support, you were very caring and supporive!
customer_reviews.author: Afraidsin

customer_reviews.title: An affordable and working stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of the stabilizer, I think the way it works it's really cool and it's actually really easy to balance, especially after watching the tutorials. My only problem is I have to buy some washers because both my phone and the videocamera I use are really light, so I have some trouble fixing the drop time, but with those I think it will be perfect. I mostly create videos in my freetime, like travel diaries, and sometimes in special occasions, like for example at my sister's wedding, so I think this stabilizer will actually improve a lot the quality of my videos.
customer_reviews.author: Giordano Boscolo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with good range of motion

I am using it in conjunction with the Lucid 3D camera to keep it level with fluid motio (very important to 3D video or photographs. This device offers a steady platform. I perused several and decided the Roxant Stabilizer the most reasonable device for a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this handle for me and my son. We love to shoot videos when we go on vacation. We're about to go on a cruise and thought this stabilizer would be good not only for walking tours but also on the boat. The look and feel of the handle are great so far. THe product feels like good quality and its not too big and heavy. I'll try to review again after we have had time to really use it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cassell

customer_reviews.title: I mostly use a GoPro as well and my iPhone and have found the ROXANT stabilizer to be exactly what I was looking for except I ha

customer_reviews.author: etpc

customer_reviews.title: Just right for small cameras. Be sure to dial in the settings.
customer_reviews.text: Looks impressive, sleek and professionals with high quality materials and craftsmanship. The Roxant Pro stabilizer offers great versatility, size and weight for use with my smaller action camera or phone. At first it felt a little clunky until I viewed the tutorials and figured out how to dial in the settings to get the perfect amount of balance and flow. I recently used it for two healthcare-related projects requiring POV shots. One project is from the perspective of a patient (re-enacting his experience interacting with various clinicians involved in his heart condition/treatment) and the other is an employee (avoiding slips, trips and falls). Very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Staylor-Made I.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and stable
customer_reviews.text: I set it up and it seems to work well. I’m using it for non-audio, creative mobile shots with a Panasonic GH4 and 25mm lens. My total camera weight is 2 lbs so it is right at the limit. I’m hoping to get a wider lens to take that weight down a bit too though. I like the design and weight. The last stabilizer I had was a long rod over 2ft long and that was clunky and not very stable. This design is superior. It feels solid and it’s pretty easy to set up. I like being able to control with one hand and it feels light.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: This product performs as expected. My son was looking for a gimbal at a decent price, and found this product. He it's very happy with it. He added a lubricant to the ball and socket joint as recommended, and it works great. He has found it has a small learning curve for finding the right balance with his camera, and is ready for action! Roxant also had great customer service and has contacted me through a coupe emails to ensure I'm satisfied with the product, offer helpful tips, and send out an additional handle for free.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Dalrymple

customer_reviews.title: Well built, but you need lessons to stabilize this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Product has great build quality! In fact, I took to the top level of a parking garage to film a car meet, and dropped the handle off a ledge to the next level down. Got ran over a few times but I could still use it! However, getting this calibrated to my Canon T5 has been quite a learning experience, and it took some time. You'll have to sit down and really play with this thing (took me a few hours over several days) to get your camera fully stabilized.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Doria

customer_reviews.title: Solid, useful stabilizer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built, useful stabilizer at a very reasonable price. It takes some time and patience to configure, and using it well is a skill that will only improve through practice. It was a challenge to properly balance a very light camera (<300g), but take the time to do it once and it just gets easier/quicker each time afterwards. Lastly, product support was great, and made the difference between a 4-star review and a 5-star review.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williford

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Sturdy Stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: It’s a well built device and very ergonomically designed. I bought it to shoot videos with my iPhone X for a new upcoming YouTube channel I am going to create where I explore abandoned places and buildings in Oregon. Thank you for this quality device!
customer_reviews.author: MannJackson

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I just worked with my Roxant for about ten minutes and have it balanced perfectly, I can shoot B-roll with the best of them! This stabilizer does what it is supposed to do and is small and easily carried in my camera bag. definitely worth the purchase for my youtube channel videos
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with my ROXANT PRO video camera stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: I set up the ROXANT PRO video camera stabilizer (ROX-1A) with my Gopro and Olympus OMD-E1. I followed the instructions on YouTube from Otis Originals. I shot my first test videos on both cameras using the device in under 30 minutes. Be sure to watch all of the Otis videos. The issues of weight, balance and "drop time" are critical to the successful use of this stabilizer. When these factors are understood, it's a five minute process setting up a new camera. The product works and it is a very, very good value.
customer_reviews.author: 40-Mile

customer_reviews.title: Close, but no cigar...
customer_reviews.text: This device disappointed me from the beginning. One custom part & several do-dads from various Chinese parts bins does not innovation make. The ball head which is left loose & used as a gimbal is s prime example. But the functional problem is due to the fact that I was unable to balance my camera laterally and front to back at the same time because of the way the cut outs for the tripod screw mount were placed. Maybe a smaller camera like a go pro would work with this, but a basic consumer DSLR won't necessarily. Also, the exact same product is available from another seller for $20 less...
customer_reviews.author: Saildanz

customer_reviews.title: Solid Build
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself to record videos for my Navy command to post online. I am not a professional but wanted to expand my options into video. The appearance is pretty impressive. Looks sturdy and not cheap at all. It is a bit heavy but nothing more than what I expected. I would take that over light and cheap. The handle feels pretty good too. The design seems to work well. Still learning the ins and outs though. Colors are great and not too flashy looking. Seems to be a minimal size which I appreciate. Nothing on the device looks or feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: john l

customer_reviews.title: Solid and of high quality
customer_reviews.text: The build of the stabilizer seems solid and of high quality. The color is well done (I like the red). I’m using it to produce a mountain biking video at one of my favorite local parks. I will be using it for shots loading up bikes, parking lot shots, pan shots along the trails. Roxant sent me a free upgrade to a shorter handle right after I purchased it from Amazon. The handle (so far) seems to work better with my iPhone 6: easier to adjust the balance and the drop time. The videos on the Roxant website are very informative and were a great help in getting me started using the stabilizer. Nice job, Roxant!
customer_reviews.author: Ken B

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: Pretty useless, I used it for a gopro and it doesn't really work very well. If you are doing one very specific movement it helps, but otherwise I can hold it more steady with my hand. With wind and anything like that it makes the camera less stable as the wind catches the stabilizer and moves the camera around. You'd be better off spending more money and getting a proper stabilizer. Considering how heavy it is I won't be using it again
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but they could improve the instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is cool, but it is really hard to get the adjustments set up just right, and if you end up adding a microphone or filter you might have to start all over again. A better setup video explaining "if your camera is falling this way, try moving it here" might have made this a four or five star experience. I ended up going with a shoulder mount for the project I bought this for, but I will probably try and revert back to the Roxant when I need to film in a tight space with consistent lighting and probably no microphone attached.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schooling

customer_reviews.title: Great Stabilizer!
customer_reviews.text: It Looks Great! It is a gift for my son. Design looks great and it seem to be good quality. My Son will be using it for Video shoots of bands and other projects. Will post some videos later! Excited that they are working on a larger Stabilizer for heavier cameras as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lowe

customer_reviews.title: With a very easy and minimal set up for balancing
customer_reviews.text: We have been extremely impressed with the build and quality of the roxant pro. Our search for a stabilizer always had us looking at units that ranged from the $500-$1000 range. We wanted a unit that we could learn and grow with and we believe we have found that in this product. We are currently using the roxant pro with a new Sony a6300. With a very easy and minimal set up for balancing, our footage seems to be very great. We look forward to uploading some footage after we get it edited. We are using the unit for video footage that allows us to follow our subjects as well as using it and moving vehicles for steady footage.

The videos come out amazing. Would definitely recommend!

customer_reviews.author: Heike Q.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and you can't find a better one for twice the price—I looked.
customer_reviews.text: Very good construction and works amazingly well, especially considering the price. Just wish there were a second knob to more securely connect the two metal extensions. Even with the washer I added, it can still pivot and I'm just using a small Canon digital video camera. Can't figure out the purpose of the rotating ballhead between the handle and the frame. I tried having it loose, but I couldn't keep the camera pointed at what I wanted to film. The plastic housing of the ballhead will likely be the first piece to break—if anything does. To me it's the most critical connection and the weakest point. I would have rather had a solid handle.
customer_reviews.author: V. J. Spindler III

customer_reviews.title: The red color is nice, the size seems compact compared to others

Just something to record our memories, not necessarily to make money.
